caption: If you are going there you should prepare for a very long wait on your food
Service is super slow! I will not recommend it 😤!

Overall, tasty “Americanized” Chinese food. Organization and operations are not great as we ordered on Xmas using their online ordering system as no one was answering the phones. I never received confirmation that they had received my online order so after calling approximately 20 times (literally) I finally did speak to someone who was very nice and was able to confirm and modify my order. He instructed me it would take at least an hour so I waited appropriately and went to pick up the food. However, I came to the restaurant only to find over a dozen people waiting for food, most of which seemed like delivery drivers. They had no clear organization system, and I could tell the kitchen and staff were overwhelmed. After waiting for about 15 minutes without being helped I asked if I could cancel my order because I couldn’t wait longer —miraculously the front person (the person I had spoken to over the phone previously) found my order right away. I paid and left, and upon arriving home, I  was pleasantly surprised and excited to find everything was as it should be. We ordered General Tso chicken, steamed vegetable dumplings, and Moo Shu chicken. The Dumplings were OK but a little doughy and not too flavorful. The General Tso chicken was excellent and not spicy as I had requested. The Moo Shu chicken was also fantastic. I definitely recommend this restart and would order again but hope that they have their ordering system and operations figured out.

I've eaten here so many times & its been really good by and large, this last time was awful! Not sure if they were just busy or what happened but it was just terrible, tasteless chopped up mish mash of ingredients.
A staple for us when we visit DC.  Unassuming downstairs location.  Best food!
Great food and great service. One of the best Chinese dishes I have ever had

An enjoyable place if you know what to order. A kitchen can only be good at so many things. My recommendation is to order the fried salt and pepper shrimp, beef chow fun noodles, snow pea shoots with garlic, and Singapore style noodles.  Update: Seems like this place has lost a step recently. Our last order left us disappointed with everything being over cooked and portions being smaller than usual. For what they charge I hope they improve.
Great food

Extremely overpriced,  nothing special about this restaurant. Ordered from DoorDash (they gave this place 4.9 stars) and they gave me the wrong order. Even the wrong order was gross. Would not reccomend.
They're the best there ever was
Amazing 10/10.
We live in the neighborhood, and New Big Wong is our favorite place to order Chinese takeout. Always fresh, tasty, and a great value.
ordered sesame chicken during quarantine - so good!!!
Great food
Food was very dry and over cooked. Specifically the crab wonton, sweet and sour chicken, and the pan fried noodles.
Great food and great service. Will be going agin when in town.
This place is the best chinese restaurant in Washington D.C.
Excellent food and atmosphere
Get the crispy salt and pepper shrimp and a side of Chinese broccoli in garlic sauce.  Wash it down with some Tsing Tao beer.  One of the best meals in Chinatown!
Looks old food They force you to pay 15% tip whether you like it or not. Extremely greasy, and rations are small.
Good food
We LOVE this place!!!! Our favorite place to visit! Love the Shrimp Fried Rice,  Cashew Chicken and both the Spring and Egg Rolls! Love that you are given water and hit tea when you arrive!

Not going to lie I didn't have a big meal it was an after party kind of thing 0300 🤔 I had two spring rolls but I was with a party of five including myself.  My friends ordered fried chicken wings, Etc the dishes were rich and flavorful they remarked. The service was prompt and polite ( Not very flexible in trying to work with alternate food options what you see is what you get lol) even though I was highly buzzed I noticed the beautiful atmosphere I will definitely recommend this place and go back to try their other seafoood or vegetable options a party of five with only one member having a light appetizer the bill was under$100 not bad.
(Translated by Google) The old Chinese restaurant in Chinatown in Washington, steamed grouper does a good job.  (Original) 华盛顿唐人街的老牌中餐馆，清蒸石斑做的不错。
Best food I have had in years
If I could I will give negative 5 stars, Obnoxious waitress who demanded tips,  service is horrible, food is over priced.
Don't get down to Chinatown very often but always try to eat here. I'm not very adventurous so the chicken fried rice and orange beef are my yummy favs!
(Translated by Google) A piece of beef fried rice costs 15 dollars. A piece of beef fried rice costs 15 dollars.  (Original) 一份牛肉炒饭要15块美金。A piece of beef fried rice costs 15 dollars.

I never write reviews and it pains me to write a negative one but DO NOT EAT HERE! I ate here for dinner last night without eating anything else afterwards and today I’ve got an awful case of food poisoning. Urgent Care said it was salmonella. Even without the food poisoning I would not recommend, food was seriously overpriced even for the portions received and it tastes like they use the same nauseatingly sweet sauce on the majority of dishes—even ones that shouldn’t be sweet.
5 of us stopped in, had a very good meal.

NewBigWong was a fun place for lunch.  Food that's OK, cheap prices, fast service, and waitresses that kind of grunted at us in some sort of unintelligible something.  The "Kiss my Grits" experience gone Asian.

Decent food, tried the pan friend noodles with chicken, but God this place is expensive. Most of the main entrees are no cheaper than $14, so Google listing this place as a single $ is sorta misleading.
Food was absolutely disgusting and overpriced! Staff was very rude and only changed attitude towards end of meal for tip wouldn’t come here ever again! 🗣
Quick and welcoming service. Yummy Vegetarian Lo Mein!
Shrimp was mindblowingly good
My favorite Chinese restaurant in DC Chinatown.

It’s my first time being here and I don’t enjoy my experience. The service is bad and waitress only recommend vey expensive food to us. The service is bad and I feel totally ignored. I will not come back again.
New Big Wong is a great late-night Chinese food spot
This place is always busy
In my opinion, the food was great. The portion was large. (I split it with my ravenous son) And the price was better than the place I tried across the street.
(Translated by Google) Bad this place  (Original) Malo este lugar

Wonton soup broth is nice, wonton are all thick skin and a suggestion of filling (not amazing) . Hamyu qiezi/ Salted fish eggplant "casserole" was pretty good!! Very comforting (if you like pungent fish flavoring, which I do). Seafood Chaofen was fine; could have been smokier. Service was super attentive! If you need something and they just dropped by (which they did regularly for us), just raise your hand and make eye contact.

Great food all around. I thought they have lunch specials. However, they don't. All dishes are at least $10 with steamed rice. You will have left overs so its good for your buck if you take home. What I didn't like about the place is the rushing of payment and prediction from the waitress about the amount of tip. Basically, she said how much is the tip which is inappropriate.
Excellent Chinese food!

it could be much better. i came in for the first time and was completely ignored. so then i came in again because i was so hungry and it took around 10 minutes for me to get noticed and so i ordered takeout.  i ordered the sweet & sour shrimp. the sweet and sour mixture was okay, it was overly sweet but you can't mess it up too terribly bad. the shrimp, however, was very greasy. the rice was rice, it was okay.  the storefront in Chinatown is okay. it can get very crowded, however and good luck getting down the stairs.

DO NOT GO HERE! They charged me $10 randomly the other day to my credit card. I was already charged the full amount plus tax and tip, and then they randomly charged me. I was charged 63.74, and then randomly charged another 10 later.

Service was absolute trash. I still tipped 15% and our waitress kept harassing me and started talking bad about my friend and I. Keep in mind we are only in high school and are using money from our summer job and we don’t have lots left. This is the money that needs to last us until Christmas lol. Mommy doesn’t give us money before that. She then grabbed two other ladies and they started yelling at us?! They wanted 25% tip... their food portions also got smaller

I ordered shrimp and fried noodles, food was decent, nothing great though. Service seemed a little rushed and there was pressure on us to hurry too. Even though I was going to tip, I was very disappointed that they rudely charged us tip without asking or mentioning anything. My friend gave them a tip and was subsequently asked for more. To top it off, we were asked to wait for our taxi in the freezing cold instead of at our table.
Food too greasy and waitress demanded payment and more than 15% tip before we even finished eating. Wouldn''t recommend.

Before we had finished eating, one of the waitresses came, interrupted us and demanded that we pay right at that moment. They forced us to give them 15% tip, didn't care about how much we actually wanted to give them. My friends who payed with cards were automatically charged with 15% tip without any questions about the tip. TERRIBLE service, somewhat decent food, but it's not worth it.

Quality of food 4/10, got fried noodles with shrimps, service lady started to bother us with very bad english/chinese that nobody understood, demanding more than 15% tip despite the bad service we were provided with. They didn't even let us finish our meals. Never again.
Food is good but not worth the price jump. Lunch specials are now 10.95 and the portions are smaller than usual. Guess your paying for the location of Chinatown. Wont be back
Great soups, fair prices and good service. The basics for a good dining experience.
Great chinese food and open late

I love this place they're fast friendly service, my favorite chief's only day off is Tuesdays.. I've been going for years now, I'd recommend this place to anyone it's my goto and I show this place off when I can haha .... Chicken lomain is my favsss
Close to inedible but the fortune cookie was great
Great food

Went there on a Friday night around 2am and ordered Shrimp Fried Rice.  It was the worst Shrimp Fried Rice I've ever had in my entire life.  It tasted old, it looked old and it had absolutely no vegetables in it.  Only shrimp, rice and a few onions.  I wouldn't serve this mess to my dog and I started to take it back and get my money back but it's a little to far to drive at this time of night.  Somebody needs to call the health department on this place because this food is not fresh.  I'm throwing it in the trash and I guess I wasted $15.35 but I also know to never ever go to that nasty place again.  BEWARE.
so fking bad
Decent food at decent prices.  Colossal portions. Decent service.
(Translated by Google) The restaurant serves Chinese dishes, with menu settings for families or groups.  (Original) Nhà hàng phục vụ các món ăn Trung Hoa, có set menu cho gia đình hay nhóm.
It’s the best Chinese food I’ve ever eaten.  I never visit DC without stopping here.
Have been coming to this olace since the 90's. My favorite restaurant in China Town. Perfect place for late night meals!
Large portions and good service.
AMAZING FOOD!!! Service was great, decor could use a little work. Overall great experience

Worst experience - Waitress gave us the bill before we had even finished our meals. Then she came back and demanded that I raise the tip to 15%. Food was decent, but all the staff came across as rude. Nothing here warranted a 15% tip. Would highly dissuade anyone from eating here.

On a mission to try all the Chinese restaurants in Chinatown, we walked into this place for dinner on a Wednesday night. It wasn't crowded, but not totally empty. For what it's worth, we ordered in Cantonese. BBQ pork, shrimp and broccoli, beef chow fun, and chicken with asparagus. The BBQ pork was terrible. It came out a pale shade of gray and was exceedingly dry and flavorless -- a shame because BBQ pork is a staple of any good Cantonese restaurant.  To our surprise everything else was delicious! The dishes came out hot, fast, and fresh. The vegetables were perfectly cooked, and the chicken and beef wonderfully tender. The chow fun noodle had good bite and didn't stick to each other but were not too greasy. And the shrimp was cooked right. We'll be back!

Before all of us could take our wallets out to pay, the waitress came to out table demanding us to give her the %15 she hovered us and watched as we wrote the tips and demanded more and more she then started saying “this is America this is America” we live in Illinois we know what it’s like. I never had an experience as awful as this one.....the food was ok, everything tasted fishy
Midnight dinner shop.We went for dinner at 3 AM and shop is still open and serving hot food. Wait staff are good. Food is tasty.
So much better than the old big Wong.
New Big Wong has salt and pepper shrimp to die for. Open ridiculously late.
Eating was not the best and the service was not friendly and they looked only for the Tip!!! When you give Not enough than she looks bad!!
(Translated by Google) Huge portions, one for two people.  (Original) Obrovské porce, jedna je tak pro dva lidi.
Great food. Good service.
Fried rice isn’t good at all. Waitress made us give a 20% tip for bad service. Never eating here again

Waiter hovered over us waiting for tip as we were paying bill at the table. The waiter then counted the money at the table and demanded a 15% tip, even after we had already tipped (roughly 13%). Service was pushy and rushed, Food was pretty whatever and overpriced. I dont recomend the spot at all.

The food was okay, but the service was bad and at the end three waitresses were demanding higher tips, which in my opinion is a no go, because in the end a tip is something voluntary and if the service just wasn't worth a big tip one should accept it... Don't recommend going there...

Pretty bad service....and expensive for whatever food....the waitress hovered over us the second she brought the bill...then said our tipping was wrong and demanded 2 more dollars (her service didn’t merit the increase)  Only good things were the hot tea and Tsingtao beer
Poor service, hounding for a higher tip. I paid with card and when I was signing she was pointing at the 20%. I said I'd pay with cash, and as soon as I put the money down the table they took it.

Poor service. Waitress kept hassling and demanding tip before we even finish eating. They also hovered near us waiting for us to put the money on the table and they snatched it right away. Really distasteful and nasty behavior.
Always fresh good food good flavor! I always stop here when I am in DC. My servers were fast and awesome, love the place.
Great place for kids. The salt and pepper shrimp was really good.
Food ... good taste, what a poor services and demand for higher tips.

I strongly recommend people NOT to go to this restraunt. I went into the restraunt (which is in the basement, BTW), and instantly get this HORRIBLE smell, coming from the restroom. Can you imaging eating in such an environment? The food is of very low quality - even worse than those from the by-the-street carryout shops. The soup is close to adding hot water to vegitable, tofu and meat. No flavor at all; steamed vegatibles are, well, STEAMED vegitable. Does the cook there even know (or care) how to add some flavor (salt, for example)? The waitresses are not friendly. They put the food on the table, and then, leave you there. The next moment they attend you is the time you pay - AND THEY CARE ABOUT THE TIP YOU GIVE (like the other reviewer wrote). I have been to many Asian restraunts, and more or less, the waitresses/waiters ask during the meal if I feel the food is ok and if I need anything else. NONE whatsoever here. WHY SHOULD THE PEOPLE THERE DESERVE MORE TIP? YOU TELL ME!!!
username: 中华复兴党大冶金牛党员

caption: Just when u thought u cant go wrong with chinese stir fry.... newbigwong marked a new low. Ordered hunan pork - and what we got was whatever was left over in kitchen. All sorts of mismatched veggie and CHARSIEW pork!!! Since when hunan pork is charsiew?! Totally spoiled the taste. They should close down the shop if they cant even take simple pride in cooking something decent... disappointed and waste of calories.
Waitress demanded an 20% tip after we stated we would be tipping 15%. Took the 20% tip out of our cash payment and refused to give back our money. BEWARE - poor food, poor service.
very good food

I used to go to this place all the time but it had been a while. I suggested it to my husband so we walked in. As we walk in the guy at the front said we dont want anything. We were so confused. He then proceeded to ask what we wanted. My husband said this is a restaurant right??? When i said you are supposed to welcome people when they come into your establishment, he just shrugged his shoulders and put his face back into his phone. I used to like this place but I'll never return. We went next door to Wok and Roll and had amazing food and service. So glad he did run us away. No wonder it was empty and everyone was next door.

The traditional Cantonese food is great. However, the service is disappointing me and my friends for many times. Honestly, this is a restaurant Which makes me feel the most disrespectful to clients in my whole life. Other waiters are good except a woman in her fifties with a round face and short hairs. She would watch you writing the tip and urge you to give more. When we take our pick-up order, she even asked me for tip as well. And she shows angry and impatience obviously if you don’t pay her tips on pick-up order. I really hope the owner of the restaurant could know what she did to many clients. It may hurt the business of restaurant.
(Translated by Google) Not bad. Quickly bring, clean, the food is delicious.  (Original) Не плохо. Быстро приносят, чисто, еда вкусная.
Great Chinese food and open til 3am!! Need I say more ; )

My favorite place for late night eats in DC. As a born-and-raised New Yorker I was surprised to find few options for eating after a night out drinking / dancing / carousing, but New Big Wong hits the marks. They have plenty of vegetarian options, and the vibe is chill and friendly.
Too expensive price for that non delicious food! Non friendly staff! They doesn’t like children! Never visit again that bad place!

Don't go to this place! My family and I were in Chinatown for a late lunch, went to this place but left when we were asked by a very rude chinese woman to sit in a good for 4 person table, while she already saw that there were 5 of us, when I told her that I want to sit where I'm sited, she talks so loud in chinese with other waitress, cursing in chinese..she even asked for an extra tip from the other customers. All customers who were there that day have a look on their faces of regret eating there..they can't wait to finish on their meal so they can run from that monster chinese woman and restaurant..plus I saw the food on their plates were horrible, I'm Asian and I know if the dish is good or not by the look of it...so don't waste your time and money on this place! Go to Chinatown Garden Restaurant instead, they're just next door. My family and I went there instead and we were treated like royal and food were excellent, I ended up giving extra tip without our waitress asking..
Very authentic NY style Chinese, food was excellent

Went to Wong after reading a couple positive reviews in local rags. Maybe I went on a bad night, but the food was really mediocre. Didn't seem any better than my local $5 greasy corner Chinese takeaway. Cost a bit more than $5 though.  Definitely seems over priced for what it is, and it's surrounded by a bunch of nicer Chinese restaurants in DC's Chinatown.

This is by far my favorite Asian restaurant in Washington, D.C.  While it's not going to win any prizes for aesthetics, the food is second to none.  I travel extensively for work, and I make it a point to visit every Chinatown I can during my travels, and every time I'm in D.C., I always visit New Big Wong. I love this little restaurant!

Last night I went to a concert at the capital one arena and that food is expensive so my boyfriend and I waited till after the show to eat we were walking and stumbled upon this place and both of us had the best experience the food was amazing and it was just all around a good experience.
Loved it

After the big Chinese New Year's parade and firecracker demonstration, the festivities continued. Traditional Dragon Dance in front of the Big Wong Restaurant, near the Friendship Archway, brought the crowds together to continue the celebration.
Food service and portions were great. Crispy spicy  beef.
Food is not bad, but not great. Service is usually the same sometimes worse.

Wanted some Asian food while in D.C. but wasn't quite sure what to settle on being on my own. Decided to just go for some Chinese food and took a gamble on this place, it ended up being pretty good. Very casual during the time I was in there around 1pm. It was quiet but the staff were active and service was swift.  They had jellyfish as you can see in the pic I uploaded as a starter and it was an unusual thing to eat as it was served cold but it was surprisingly good. The place isn't overly fancy but that isn't a bad thing, if anything I felt more comfortable with it being that way. I recommend it.
Crispy duck is delicious!
Food is good. Staff are cranky.
Great late night chinese joint. Food slaps and they have crab rangoon.

Food was nice but the waitress was so rude with my family (and te table beside), trying to kick us out right after we stopped  eating because there were people waiting. And bathroom was  dirty. Asked for extra  tip.

(Translated by Google) The service was super salty!!! The service was terrible!!! Demand 15% tips. The waitress were loud and rude. Bathroom was not clean too. Never will go again!!! The food is very salty!!! The service attitude is very poor!!! It is also a strong 15% tip. The waiter was loud and rude. The bathroom is not clean. No more next time!!!  (Original) The food was super salty!!! The service was terrible!!! Demand 15% tips. The waitress were loud and rude. Bathroom was not clean too. Never will go again!!! 食物很咸!!! 服务态度很差!!!还强要15%小费。服务员大声又没礼貌。卫生间也不干净。再也没有下次!!!
waiter forces you raise the tip. Very rude
Rude waiter asked 15% if you left 10% or 20% if you left 15% for lunch. They stand aside by watching you write the tip, and demand you change it to a higher amount. Never back.
LOVE IT. ALWAYS GREAT.
Best Chinese food around!

OKAY FOOD, POOR SERVICE, DISHONEST I'd like to start off this review stating that I work in the service industry and realize the importance of honesty and transparency, as well as respect. I have never felt more disrespected or been more livid with an establishment in my life-- in fact, it's taken me 5 days to even come to leave this review in hopes that someone will see it and save themselves the headache. This restaurant is at the beginning of Chinatown in Washington DC and it's open late night, unlike some of the restaurants nearby. I came in with two friends on Saturday night; two of us were visiting the city and one is local. As for the food, it's your regular Chinese/Cantonese menu; eggrolls, beef and broccoli and an assortment of noodle dishes. None of the food was exceptionally good, although I'm not sure that the staff cared seeing that they never came by to check on our food after we received it. It's an intimate space and I was very excited to see what they had to offer. During our meal, my friends and I witnessed one of the waitresses screaming at a man out in the lobby because he had dozed off while waiting for his to go order. Initially, I thought this was bizarre and unprofessional, but kept on with my meal. When it came time to pay, I asked the waitress for change for $100 bill. My friend paid for my meal on his debit card and I intended to leave her a cash tip. When she brought back my money, I quickly counted it as she stood there waiting. She rudely interrupted our exit and asked "tip in cash?". This immediately irritated me because as I stated, I am in the service industry myself and that's just something you don't do. She continued to stand there and I gave her a tip that I felt was reflective of her service- we left. When I got back to the car, I counted the change in my hand and realize that I was short. I didn't have a chance to count the money thoroughly when I was inside the restaurant because the waitress was being so invasive. I quickly went back inside to see what had happened and both women were sitting there almost waiting on my return. The waitress tried to explain that she gave all my change back, but I am fully aware of my belongings. I requested to have my money returned. The two exchanged some conversation and I told them to just give my money back ($10 was all I asked for). The woman in charge gave me $10, apologized and told me to have a good night. However, after returning to the car again, I realized that I was actually missing $30 in total and had only gotten a portion back. Not sure if I happened to drop money on the floor and it was picked up or the waitress never gave me back all of my change to begin with, but that's beside the point. This place LACKS HONESTY AND INTEGRITY and I spent the rest of my trip telling others to NEVER visit. You just don't do that to people. It's a shame that this particular waitress finds the need to prey on people who are just trying to have a nice experience. I hope that you used the $20 in a way that is useful.
Good portions, relatively cheap, mediocre service

The food was good. Service was good. It's open late nights. I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp, Ate here for the first time while visiting DC for research in 2011. Hands down the BEST Chinese food I've had in the US. Authentic Chinese food. Good food. Big menu, lot of choices, felt somewhat rushed to order, but overall I’d recommend it!
Great authentic chinese food. Amazing service.
Good food and service.
The food here is good but the service in the restaurant is extremely unorganized  and the staff not the nicest
Really good chinese. Doesn't taste "cheap" like other places.

(Translated by Google) Excellent food and very good service. The portions plentiful and reasonable price.  (Original) Excelente comida y muy buena atención. Las porciones abundantes y precio razonable.
A subterranean location, simple food and service. Delivery and take-away. Late night spot. Cash only!
I love it!! Been coming here for a few years and the food is always excellent and the people are nice!!!
(Translated by Google) Wong'd  (Original) Wong'd

Great cozy place for yummy Chinese in China Town!
The best!

Ate here for the first time while visiting DC for research in 2011. Hole in the wall authentic Chinese food. Hands down the BEST Chinese food I've had in the US. Confirmed by my recent dining companion who spent years living in Hong Kong. No frills, friendly, fast, family style dining.
Unless it's police week, and I am hammered, I don't come here... And I'm a local.
Bad service , the food was horrible and my stomach is felling so bad I dont recomend it
Very tasty and for a suitable price

The food was good. Service was good. It's open late nights. I ordered the Jumbo Shrimp, Hunan Style and Egg Roll (shrimp and beef). The Hunan Shrimp could have been a little more spicy, but it was still good.
Good food liked it very much
Authentic Chinese food. Good food. Big menu, lot of choices, felt somewhat rushed to order, but overall I’d recommend it!
Worst service I've ever had in a restaurant. Staff were so uninterested and demanded their 15% tip. Food was ok but not worth it for the service given. Avoid
Actually, I didn't eat here, just walked by...but it gets 5 stars for the name alone!
I had the salted fish and bean curds. Regretfully, it wasn't to my taste.
Best Chinese food I've ever had
The best authentic Chinese restaurant in DC!  The food is always hot and fresh, the service friendly and the selection unrivaled. Open late everyday...try the crispy duck- impeccably succulent!
Amazing
(Translated by Google) The service attitude is very poor, the tip is too small, I will never come again next time, give half a star.  (Original) 服务态度很差，给小费还嫌少，下次再也不了来了，给半颗星。
Amazing and authentic Chineese food
Great authentic food and great service. Comes with Jasmine tea. I recommend this restaurant to anyone.
Fum, delicious, authentic. We had a wonderful meal of duck and jelly fish . Reasonable prices as well
The meals are delicious!
Lovely food and great value.... Child friendly

My son and I are here ordering orange chicken and mooshoo (sp???) chicken and a couple spring rolls.  We were very happy with our food and service.  The restaurant is small and it's clear they are trying to turn tables and get people in/out quick.  I found our waitress to be nice enough as ND differently not ride.  If you want a relaxing meal, this may not be the spot but the place was filled with 90+ percent Asian's speaking in Asia languages so they're doing something right even if it's not for you.

Came here yesterday and while the food was great, came out fast, and we had free water and tea, the service staff was a bit rude to us. First of all, my friend ordered General Tso's bean curd because she's vegetarian, but they gave her chicken. Then, we were given our check when we weren't finished yet and then the waitress stood over us while we added the tip to our receipts. Also, when I started to put my leftovers into the box, the waitress took it from me and did it herself, without saying anything to me. Additionally, the prices were ridiculous. I paid almost $19 for a shrimp fried rice noodle dish with a 10% tax and 15% tip added on. And then the fortune cookies were very stale. I wouldn't bother going here again.
Peking duck was great.
Delicious. Food came quickly and was priced fairly. We are from out of town and this was a random pick, so it was especially pleasing. Portions were generous.
We enjoyed the meal, it was a fair price for the location and the portions were a good value.
Ok Chinese food family style.
(Translated by Google) Very good recommendation if you want Chinese food  (Original) Muy buena recomendación si se quiere comida china
Probably one of the bear Chinese food places I've been outside of Chinatown in NYC. The prices are not what you would expect for DC. Definitely worth the walk from the mall.
Great food at a great price. Huge portions, nice atmosphere, a local favorite.

I sort of enjoyed our meal here. There are a lot of restaurants to choose from around the metro rail station, hard to decide on just one. Part of our desicion to eat here was based on price. They all seem to be around the same price point although a few were more costly. This place is in a basement and very small. I think there was only around 10 tables so we had to wait a little bit. All the servers were Asian, and were not very friendly. They seemed to be rushing my order. We were served hot tea as we sat down at no charge. There were 3 of us sitting at a large table, so without asking us, they sat 2 more people at our table. I didn’t mind, but they should have asked first. The food was served quickly. It seemed to be authentic, as I ended up ordering something I didn’t like because it was a special designed for 2 or 3 people. Roast Duck was dry and yucky. I found out I do not like watercress soup. The veggies were not very flavorful and a little undercooked. We also had plain rice and large seasoned shrimp with the heads still attached. That turned my stomach although I did try it and it was dry. The menu said dessert was included so I asked our server about it. She said it was an orange, then she brought out diced pineapple. I forgot that Asian restaurants never have decent desserts! I tipped under 15%, and  I wasn’t hassled about it at all.
The new big Wong isn't that big! Well it's certainly not the biggest I've had. It's more like the ol'average Wong.
Nice cozy place....went for the roast pork steamed buns...I think it's the only one in the area.
Good food
Ask for the Chicken Big Wong style
Foods were cold and subpar. When we tipped less than 15%, the waitress said loudly that we need to put in “$10 = 15%.”

I wanted to give zero stars but the lowest that you can give is 1. Horrible and rude service. Waiter did not want to serve. Forced us to tip her “15%”! Did not know that this was required for a party of 4. We tipped her $6 for a check of $65 and she was not satisfied and demanded her 15! Don’t ever come here again. Avoid at all cost!!! Place is not the cleanest either. Found a roach in the restaurant.
Pretty decent if pricy for what it was. Service wasn’t great we were offered neither tea nor wonton chips. The employees didn’t look too happy to be there.
Rude waitresses, dirty place

Just wandered in looking to support a Chinese restaurant. For standard Cantonese fare, this place does... Average. Or slightly less than average. Service was ok and had the right amount of servers for the size of the restaurant. They spoke Cantonese and Mandarin. I wanted to order an eggplant chicken casserole/pot which comes pretty standard in Cantonese restaurants but it wasn't on the menu. Usually places will put it together for you since it's not hard, but this one didn't or at least the server didn't write it down right. So we ordered an eggplant dish on the menu, the beef short ribs with eggplant casserole and the tofu with veggies. The latter came with tons of veggies which was great. The former I think was two separate dishes smashed together. Which wasn't bad, just different. Both were entirely on the salty side though. Portions were large and the two of us didn't finish the food.
Great food! Open late! Quick service!

Wow, not sure why the reviews for this place are so low. I've been eating here since 2002 and have never had a bad meal or bad experience. Anybody that I've ever taken to the place agrees that the food is excellent. The prices are very modest. Go in the evening and get "the real Chinese menu".
Great food!
Delicious spicy pork ribs.
Canceled our reservation for an entire 8th grade class of 26 for another family of 5. The staff there are awful  and yeah that pretty much sums it up.
0/10 would never go there, they lost our reservation, so we starved.
Good food and good price

I go here often! I live and work within 4 blocks of this restaurant.The food us Amazing, howevervsometimes the service is sub par. I try to order food to go so I din’t have to deal wit it. But the food is worth it if you wNt somewhat authentic great Chinese in Chinatown!

Both our waitress & the manager attempted to refuse a MasterCard one of the members of our party wanted to use for payment. They accepted MasterCard, just not this one because of the Co-brand partner.  Pretty sure that’s a violation of their merchant agreement with MasterCard.  They refused to run the card until we took back all the cards and threatened to walk...very unprofessional. Used to love the food, will not be back.
The worst Chinese restaurant I’ve ever visited. Very disappointed.
Bad food bad service
Average food and reasonable price. Environment is a bit old school

Very bad and unfriendly service, the BBQ pork was dry and had an old taste, the cutlery and the toilets was dirty. That's why we decided to give only 10% tip... but the lady forced us to give 15%. Please go somewhere else! I will never ever come back.
Bugs were in my shrimp and broccoli that I paid $16.95 for...... do not I repeat, do not eat from this pace. The health department needs to step in.
Great food and pleasent envirinment. Too much food to finish eating even when shared with the table.
Food was fantastic! Service was great! Tea was amazing!
Great Honey Walnut Shrimp!!!
General tso is the best
Bad service!

Bad service, when we are paying our bill she said the tip is not included and remind us to give the tip, we first give her a 10% tip but she said the tip is 15%, so we try to take away the 10%($3) and give her the 15%($5) and she said “it’s ok that you leave that $3”. I have never meet a service that is terrible like this!!!
Great food, great service, fantastic prices.  Has football on Sundays as well.  Just a block or so east of the Gate
I'm Taiwanese and this is real Chinese food. Very delicious.
Food is great, service is ok
Good but it felt that all tasted a bit the same and our spicy dishes were not spicy at all. Best was the beef casserole.
The food was great and the waitress we had was very nice and always available. Never had an empty glass.
Food wasn't good for Chinese . Very disappointed.  Service was so so....
The vegetarian options were really good.

(Translated by Google) The food is very good .. The best we have had in a long time .. But the attention and service is lousy, table for me and my family without any extra that is essential in it as the sauces I had to call several times at waitresses to order things and to put the cherry on the cake at the time of the tip still demanded me 15% to take their obligatory tip 😤😤😤  (Original) La comida es muy buena.. La mejor que hemos probado en en mucho tiempo.. Pero la atención y servicio es pésimo, mesa para mi y mi familia sin ningún extra que es esencial en ella como las salsas   tuve que llamar varias veces a las meseras para pedir cosas y para poner la cereza en el pastel a la hora de la propina todavía me exigio el 15% para llevarse su propina obligatoria 😤😤😤
Dirty as hell
The best orange chicken I have ever had in my entire life
Very authentic Chinese food.

The food was overly expensive and didn't even taste very good relative to what it was worth. Broccoli was undercooked and cookies were stale. On top of that the waitress we had was very rude, demanding her tip when I had just paid her and received my change. She demanded that I leave her "at least $3." The tea was really good though. DON'T GO HERE THIS PLACE IS TRASH.
Pricy but definitely delicious!

Unpleasant ambiance. Everything is negative starting from the crew, the food, etc.  Stay away from this place. I guess we will be serving our selves and still have to give them tip. It is true what everyone is saying on their review to this place. They will hem you up for the tip.
Great food... bitchy staff!!!! Maybe because I was the only dark skin person there idk... didn't like the service at all!!!!

THIS PLACE IS TRASH. DO NOT GO HERE! If I could give this place zero stars I would. When I was getting ready to place my order, I was hardly even acknowledged. I ordered the general tso's chicken and it tasted exactly like the orange chicken. There was more breading and sauce then there was chicken. And The chicken itself had a very bad texture and was not appetizing at all. The rice was extremely bland, and for the price I paid I could've eaten more and had better food at panda express, or even the food court in any shopping mall. The tea kettle they brought for us wasn't clean at all, and my fork wasn't either. There was also a brown speck stuck in between the fork, so obviously they don't do dishes very well. I peeked into the kitchen and was absolutely disgusted. Poorly maintained, and definitely far from clean. The mere sight of the kitchen made me want to throw up. I paid 16.45, which was far too expensive for what I received. When she gave me my check, she said "make sure to leave a tip", as if I were  obligated to do so considering the service I recieved. I was stared down when I received my change, and when I proceeded to walk out one of the servers chased me out of the store demanding a tip. She gave me and my friend a demeaning stare and made us feel like we obligated to put more than a dollar (and that was us being polite). She raised her voice at us just yelling "fifteen percent!". This same server was the same person who sneezed in their hands and then gave a different group their menu's. I've never been more unsatisfied in my life at any food service establishment. Even if I don't enjoy a place, it is very seldom I write a bad review - but this place was genuinely the worst place I've ever been too. I decided to try something new, and ended up longing for McDonald's. Avoid at all costs.

If I could give zero stars I would. First off when we got there we needed two high chairs and they only had one so we had to hold an 8 month old baby in out laps the entire time. They had booster seats for the high chairs but did not let us know. The waitresses constantly gave dirty looks when one of the children was crying. The bathrooms were disgusting and at the end of all that she came up and jerked the receipt out from under my arm and when she saw I didn't leave a 15% tip she repeatedly told me "15% tip" 4 times before giving up and walking away to talk bad about us to other waitresses. Never in my life have I had this happen and I always leave good tips. I tip based on the service I receive.
Food was really delicious, but the waitresses were rude! After not having the best service, they still tried to make me tip at least 15%. They got lucky they got anything at all.
Food was great.. but the customer service definitely needs improvement .. AND they watch you as you sign your receipt so they make you tip them at least 15% ..

Yes continue reading the Reviews  Simple. All was well until one of the waitresses served my soup and she had one of her fingers inside my soup.  She did not apologize at all. Either change the soup.  Plus you have to tip them as if it were an obligation
Pathetic restaurant with worst service . They are rude and chase you down make you feel criminal if you don't put atleast 15% tip.
Their BBQ dishes are not freshly made on the same day.  Don't order it.
The salted tofu is out of this world!!   The food is delicious, the place sacrifices decor for cheap prices, quality cooking, and large portions.  One of the best places in DC!
I've have ate here on every trip to DC over 6 years 12-15 times and the food has al ways been OUTSTANDING!!! Great service and great prices!!!

Worst customer service I've EVER experienced. I should have turned around and walked out as soon as it seemed like an inconvenience for then to seat my family of 4. After being ignored while we sitting at the table for 15 minutes, I finally had to ask someone to take our order, again they seemed irritated we would make such a request. They never checked up on us and never brought anything I asked for. They were so rude to every table, I honestly can't believe they were as crowded as they were. Food was mediocre, certainly not the best. My husband and I refused to tip (which we have NEVER done) and they literally chased us out the door yelling at us. My poor 6 year old who is in a Chinese immersion program and so excited to go to Chinatown ran out and even left her new Chinese fan and toys behind at the table :( I wish we never went there.
Unpleasant place. Food was really subpar and staff was rude. Can't justify the price or anything. I will not be returning.
adequate, not great
(Translated by Google) Ga  (Original) Gaahh

Easily the worst restaurant experience I've ever had. The plates our waitress handed to us were filthy, and she wiped them off with her hands before giving them back. My girlfriend didn't even get to finish giving her order to the waitress before she walked away. The food was absolutely terrible on top of the fact that it was cold. We didn't get a single refill because we were so rushed. I left a low tip, reflecting the poor service, and they chased us down demanding a larger one! Unbelievably awful experience.

I would never return to this place. The food was terrible, "general tso's" chicken that looked exactly like the orange chicken that was served to us, was basically all breading and no actual meat. Our server made an error and overcharged my receipt, rather than fix it and bring a new receipt she demanded $16.45 from me (all I ordered was the general tso's chicken) insisting that was the correct total and she'd fix it in the back. Very sketchy if you ask me. I've worked as a server and usually tip 20% minimum but decided that her blantant disrespect did not warrant any tip. After collected our receipts from the table, she came back to confront me about not tipping (something I'd never ever do when I served). She left the receipt on the table expecting me to add a tip and when she came back for it seeing I didn't add any additional money she gave me a death stare and obviously trash talked about us in her native language. Extremely unprofessional, seems like they consistently bully their customers.
Terrible service and a bit overpriced. The only pro was that the food was served quickly.
Wasn't too impressed... For the price, you could eat much better at Panda Express. The staff was pretty rude and rushed us out of our seats even though the restaurant was nearly empty.
Dumplings here are amazing!!! OG Chinese decor and round tables galore. Service was great for an Asian place (since most don't care about you...just that you pay them and you get your food).
Fast, efficient service. One of the few places open late at night/early morning - great opportunity to meet some incredible chefs/bartenders after they close up shop

The service was so bad that I attempted to tip below 15% for the first time in my life. The waitress watched me as I signed (literally the most attention she gave us the whole night) and cornered me as I stood up and wouldn't let me leave until I gave her more money. After talking to her for about 30 seconds I decided it wasn't worth it and threw down more money. Yikes
Really great place for family-style Chinese just steps from the Verizon Center and Gallery Place.

The worst. Sweet and sour chicken not good. If you want fried rice instead of steam they add $1.50. Canned soda $1.50. Ordered wine and my husband a beer never asked us if we wanted anything else. Brought water but could not catch waitress to get refills or a box. My husband orange chicken was good. I am normally a good tipper but not this time. When she brought bill she just hovered waiting to get the money. Complained about us not leaving 15% and said something to the other waitress while holding the tip money in her hand and shaking it at my husband. My husband took the money and said if you don't want the tip I gave you that is fine and we left. Almost ruined our evening.

Despite bad ratings we headed over here anyhow due to the good looking vegetarian menu alone. The place got packed in a hurry, but they took great care of us and at least three 8+ person parties around us. Staff were friendly and there different people helped us order, get the check, and pack leftovers. Food was great, we had two different soups, fantastic dumplings, and veggie fried rice done right. If we had another meal in town, we'd go back. Perfect first experience.

Ordered to go, food was served in a decent time. While waiting for the food we were having a good time, so we told the waiter/cashier we change our mind and wanted to eat in. The service and attitude became apparent. We were asked to move from the table and placed next to the door. We asked for plates and utensils was only given 1 while it was 4 of us. When asked for another plate we were told they were out.  Just horrible service.  No need to go back.

Go to spot for some good Cantonese food after long night in D.C. This place is usually gets packed late in the evenings. Portions are average size and the food is reasonably priced. Parking is always easy to find. The poor waitresses here are always so kind serving us drunken belligerent folks in the evenings. Any soup, chow fun, pan fried noodles, clams in black bean sauce, shrimp with walnuts are my favorite orders here. They have plenty of seating for small to large parties. Highly recommend this place if you need a quick bite in the area.
The food was OK (especially the rice and orange chicken) but service... was very bad. And when she saw that we are leaving less than 15% tip - got angry and asked for a bigger tip. Wow..

Great food. Simple, well done, and original. I like that the restaurant has little influence of American culture, preserving its original chinese origin. The waiters also speak mainly chinesr, another good sign in my opinion. Only drawback is the feeling of being in the basement, but the owners make a good job at creating a nice atmosphere with what they have.

When we asked for rice, I watched the waitress pick up a bowl of unused rice from the table next to us, take it to the back, and reheat it.   The is a filthy practice and I will not be returning here again.

The vegetable dumplings were inedibly doughy. The 4 waitstaff were more concerned with their own meal than the customers.  Did not check on us once, no water refills even. The noodles were deceptively not warm. Trying someplace else next time.

From the time we walked in I should have walked right out...all 3 waitresses were eating and after about 30 seconds one got up and seated us....after bringing our drinks she sat back down and continued to eat....after they ate they all got on their cell phones....not once were we asked "is everything OK?"...no here comes the funny part.....I am a great tipper....when deserved so of course I left NO tip....when they noticed that all 3 jumped out of their seat and reminded me to leave a tip in which I replied "GO BACK TO YOUR TABLE AND GET BACK ON YOUR PHONES BECAUSE IN THE 30 MIN WE WERE THEIR YOU DID NOT ONCE TREAT US LIKE PAYING CUSTOMERS".
It was alrught, the food OK. Prices..OUTRAGEOUS.
the food was cheap, viscous, and the service resentful. in the end they tried to force us to give a better tip. enjoyed seeing all the families eating there.

Just had dinner.  The total was 42 16 and the lady INSISTED that 15 % tip is  included WITHOUT CLEARLY STATING ANYWHERE so she said 8$ tip is tip. She ripped us off and forced us to pay. Reporting to better business Bureau immediately for scamming.
The food was so gross, and the waitress demanded a tip over 20%. Won't be surprised if I get food poisoning tonight.
Food was dry except the sweet and sour chicken, it was good some of the plates are good for 2 people. Make sure you leave your 15% she will through a fit!
Service wasnt anything special but the food was good and cheap

Ordered the shrimp dumpling soup and the shrimp dumpling and noodle soup, along with the crabmeat fried wontons (basically crab rangoons). The crab rangoons were fairly small but were tasty. The soups were both amazingly good and well priced at $8.99. The place is also open until 4/5 am on Friday and Saturday nights, so it's convenient if you're in the area, but around the time the bars all close, it will become crowded with loud drunk people.
Extremely terrible, very unfriendly and forced us to pay 18% tips. The food was bad and the place is dirty. Have lots of room for improvement

Worst wonton noodles ever with hard noodles and thick skinned wonton. Service was horrible and they forced us to pay 15% tips before letting us go! Will never go again! Frustrating service and horrible food!

HORRIBLE service, they never gave us refills, slammed our tableware on the table, the waitress came to finally take our ordered and her phone rang and she left the table and continued to talk to her friend and have a giggle, then took our order 15 minutes later, the food was cold, disgusting and bland. (buy some pf changs in the freezer isle at your grocer instead) Despite our horrible experience we still left a tip only for the waitress to stop us from leaving and tell us we didnt tip her 15%. NEVER coming back. Worst restaurant in my opinion. Wish I could give it 0 Stars.
Really good well worth it
Nothing on earth is more terrible than this restaurant service, but the food is excellent!!
Wonderful late night Chinese! Fast service, yet smaller portions than I would have liked

So bad service. Maybe I didn't come with others for the lunch. They just ignored me, and even "let me move" and "go to the coroner". Both three service ladies had the same death face on me. I felt insulted and left then. Again, such a worse service without any basic respect to its guests!
Great food.
A little more expensive than Google suggested. Food was still good and restaurant was busier than I would expect for a Sunday late evening.
Good Chinese a little bland, but overall great quality. Good prices for DC.

I went against the reviews on this one, to find out for myself.  I'm glad I did. The food was great, we shareda mixture of the sweet/sour, KungPao, General Tso and Seasame Chicken with egg rolls. Typical Chinese dishes, but really good. We had ok service, not great but not bad. They were friendly enough for Chinese. (you know what i mean). It's weird the first picture is of the resturant across the street...lol.. review trickery. :)

This place is bleh. I will never return.  I've been to a few Chinatowns (Chicago, NY, the ones in California) and this one by far the worst Chinatown, EVER!! My boyfriend and I were there for a Wizards game at the Verizon Center, which is nearby. We thought we might want to grab a bite in Chinatown before we head into the 2-3 game and spend ridiculous dollars for hot dogs and nachos at the stadium.  We strolled around and decided to settle here because it doesn't look very crowded (which is something you never do, no business means they are not on par, right?). We ordered a salty fish chicken fried rice and (tried to be adventurous) snails with black bean paste (think escargot but with the shell and you have to figure out how to get the snail out from its shelter to eat it). Fried rice was alright, but we literally spent most of our time trying to figure out how to eat the snails.  Price was not okay for the food we had. It was $40+ for two plates of food. I am guessing we are paying for the location/rent so I will let this go. Next time I will just get a chipotle-to-go before the game. I am slowly losing hope for this already-sloppy-Chinatown in DC.
I love the combination fried rice!!!  The service is great too!
Rude, food is rotted and really bad. I often tip 20% but for this one I tipped 10% and they askrd me to add 5%. Avoid it. Should read review before

I will never step foot in this disrespectful UNPROFESSIONAL Establishment ever again. First off I was seated in a ridiculously awkward place next to the customer service desk and people kept reaching over and standing behind me. After I paid the bill an employee stood next to the table I'm thinking she was waiting for the plates but oh no she was waiting for a tip. She literally told me to leave a $4 tip telling me that in DC it is a minimum of $4. Last time I checked it was at the customers discretion to leave a tip. That just made the whole experience bad.
Im not one for chinese food, but my family loved it and the service was great!

Service is slow, but what can you expect when you don't speak their language? Having said that, I thought we would be in for a real treat. To my disappointment, that was not the case. The food was not flavorful. The rice and noodles had good texture as they should.  I really like that they anticipate your hot treat order by bringing you tea cups to set your table.

new big mistake!!!!! ordered beef , was chewy and un eatable. chicken was bad as well. chicken lo mein which is the kids favorite  was left as is in the plate. horrible bye taste. and the service is straight with no smile .after we asked for the bill and the server saw we left all the dishes UN eaten , she didn't ask why what ..... she was standing behind my shoulder trying to see what tip i am leaving.  when she saw that the tip was under 10% (as food and service are bad)  she started mumbling and complaining at us. no understanding of customer service. in their world  unhappy client must leave nice tip. unbelievable.!!!  never again. the ultimate tourist catch.  never before i left a negative review on a business , as i know peoples livelihood is to be taken serious. but when you pay hefty prices for BAD food and HORRIBLE service. and then receive "blessings" in Chinese language    cause your tip is not high enough ... so i wrote my take on a very poor experience.

We were in the area visiting family and wanted to try some Chinese food.  We decided to try this restaurant out.  The food was reasonably priced and tasted good.  The service however had something to be desired.  They were very rude and when asked questions they walked away while answering.  They hovered after giving you the bill, and complained when the tip was not what they expected.  As soon as the tip money was on the table, they never showed back up again even though more of the drinks would have been nice.

Great Food, BUT be prepared if you do not leave a Big enough tip for them. They will force you to leave a tip over 15% and not let you leave if you do not! Been there Several Times now and will not return.
Deep Fried Spicy Pork Chop...amazing!

Read the whole thing, folks: It's cheap. It's delicious. It's right next to the Gallery Place metro entrance. The spring rolls alone keep my girlfriend coming back, and I love everything they put on a plate. Edit: It's still amazing. Keep in mind that nearly every negative review is at least 1-6 years old, and if you were to go by the recent reviews made after they cleaned up their act they'd be a 5-star takeaway. Every recent review has praised it except for one complaint about it not being what they serve in mainland China. Nobody's perfect.

If you like Cantonese food it was your standard fair.  The only thing authentic was the snow peas and garlic.  It's probably fine by most people's standard but after living in China,  I considered it barely edible. The bathrooms were surprisingly nice.
Food is excellent- gotta have the snow pea leaves with garlic and the dry scallions fried rice- but the servers get pretty aggressive to have their 15% tip.
My favorite Chinese restaurant in Chinatown.  Great food, great prices, friendly staff.

DO NOT EAT HERE.  I went there for lunch on a weekday and I should have known from the start that it would not be a good experience.  The waitresses looked like they hadn't showered in a while and the lighting was dark and it just seemed unclean.  The food was mediocre but thankfully cheap.  I had maybe two bites of my food and just came to terms with the fact that I wasn't going to eat a good lunch.  The second we asked for the check the BIGGEST COCKROACH I honestly have ever seen crawled up the wall.  The woman who was right next to it screamed bloody murder and I don't blame her.  The waitress took care of the situation way too comfortably as if she has had to before.  Within a minute she grabbed a chair, squished the ginormous bug and wiped the wallpaper and walked away. There was no apology or even no sense of surprise from the waiters and waitresses. It was gross beyond belief and I will never step foot in there again or let anyone I know go in there.  We told patrons outside to enter at their own risk.  I never go on to review restaurants unless it was an amazing experience or in this case a horrible horrible one.  I have no idea how this place has so many "excellent" reviews.  I am truly baffled.
